items.content_html: RexGT is a lightweight open-source service powered by OpenAI's ChatGPT providing a backend API that allows users to interact with ChatGPT and receive chat completions based on various categories or DALL-E images based on prompt. This repository serves as the foundation for building the service using ChatGPT.
items.title: Marcus-Johnson/RexGT: RexGT is a lightweight open-source service powered by OpenAI's ChatGPT providing a backend API that allows users to interact with ChatGPT and receive chat completions based on various categories or DALL-E images based on prompt. This repository serves as the foundation for building the service using ChatGPT.

items.content_html: React Hook Form is a powerful and intuitive library for managing forms in React applications. It offers a simple API, built-in validation, error handling, and form state management. With a lightweight footprint and excellent performance, it enables developers to create efficient and interactive forms with ease.
items.title: sami12344/React-Hook-Form: React Hook Form is a powerful and intuitive library for managing forms in React applications. It offers a simple API, built-in validation, error handling, and form state management. With a lightweight footprint and excellent performance, it enables developers to create efficient and interactive forms with ease.

items.content_html: React-Router-Filebased is a lightweight npm package designed to simplify your React application's routing process. This package is built on top of the popular React Router Dom v6 library and includes file-based routing with lazy loading capabilities, making it easier to manage your application's routes.
items.title: dev-mohamed-hussien/react-router-filebased: React-Router-Filebased is a lightweight npm package designed to simplify your React application's routing process. This package is built on top of the popular React Router Dom v6 library and includes file-based routing with lazy loading capabilities, making it easier to manage your application's routes.
